content.description: Nice little Crack problem. Alot of jamming and stacking. Rocks a little grainy but not unreasonable.
content.location: Found on west base of the hill that is located in the dirt parking lot on the way to K-Rock

content.description: Same start as Half Penny. Just traverse right into the middle of the slab and Cruise to the top. Could also be a pretty bad fall.
content.location: Just to the right of half penny.

content.description: This is the variation to the 5.9+ route. You go up the crack leading to the right.
A crimpy slab just east of Pocket Rocket, need a good pad on account of jagged trench and rocks at start.
content.location: Obvious small face just east of PR.

content.description: Getting off the ground (if you start with low hands) is the crux. Good features but like most boulders here, alot of the attractive features are loose. Giggity.
content.location: North of Pocket Rocket, visible from there. Maybe 20 yards.

content.description: Cool little bouldering cave that has a bunch a jugs drilled all over it.
content.location: If you follow the canyon that heads northeast from the K-Rock you'll find it.

content.description: Nice boulder face with great holds, easy climbing with plenty of options. The left side is V0ish, the right is VB.
content.location: At the start of the trail to K-Rock/Pocket Rocket on the left side. The only nice slab with V0 features.
If you're looking at K-rock, its the big boulder to you left you pass on the trail to Pocket Rocket.

content.description: Nice small problem if your at Pocket Rocket, just be aware that alot of the features are loose.
content.location: Just NW of Pocket Rocket, maybe 30ft away

climbs.name: Half Penny
climbs.fa: Jorden Darr It could really be anyone though

content.description: The crux is a slabby left foot near the top to high step right.Then you gain the jugs and topout. Could be a really bad fall.
content.location: Large bolder just to the left of pocket rocket. Its the farthest line to the left.

content.description: Fun crack climb up the center of the formation. Halfway up you transition left to the face on clip a couple bolts to the anchors. The crux is the layback on the face once you step out of the main crack.
content.protection:
You need a trad rack for the crack section, but the face has a couple bolts.

We always top roped it but you need to make sure you use a pretty long sling or the rope can get some major friction on the face.
content.location: Follows the large, easy crack in the center of the formation, halfway up and then you move out left to a small lay back and then straight up past a couple bolts. Anchors on top.
